newsitem.title: USA: CSX train derails in Washington, no injuries.
newsitem.headline: CSX train derails in Washington, no injuries.

text.p: A CSX Corp. freight train derailed in Washington shortly before 6:30 p.m. EDT on Tuesday, but no injuries were reported, local NBC-TV affiliate, WRC-TV, said.

The television station showed live footage of the train, which derailed just south of the 14th St. railroad bridge. An Amtrak train was halted near the site of the derailment and was apparently waiting for debris to be cleared before continuing, WRC said.
Local police and transit authorities could not immediately confirm the accident.
WRC said six cars of the CSX sideswiped the Amtrak train before coming off the track.
A CSX official confirmed the derailment, but had no further details. Amtrak officials were not immediately available for comment.
